snippet: In a reflection of how tight the legal job market is, the school is offering to repay 15 percent of total tuition costs to those who have not found full-time work nine months after graduating.
abstract: Brooklyn Law School will begin offering 15 percent tuition repayments to graduates who fail to find full-time jobs within nine months of graduation; program is meant to address daunting competition and depressed job market that have coincided with steep drop off in enrollment.
lead_paragraph: In a reflection of how tight the legal job market is, the school is offering to repay 15 percent of total tuition costs to those who have not found full-time work nine months after graduating.

headline.main: Brooklyn Law School Offers a Safety Net for New Students
headline.print_headline: Brooklyn Law School to Provide a Safety Net for Students
